comment: Quizzes are open note and easy, you'll find answers straight from the textbook. Discussion posts are an easy 100. 3 exams and all very hard, even if you study and watch exam review videos he posts. He tells you the short answers that are on each exam in the videos, but they are never what he says they are. No feedback given for anything.

This class is ok weekly, but the exams ruin your grade. Even if you get 100s on everything, it won't matter because the exams weigh so heavy. I studied for days to barely receive 70s. No study guides and what he tells you to study for the short answer is never right, so don't waste your time. Short responses and unhelpful when asked how to improve.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Class is 26% Quiz, 14% Discussion Post, 20% Midterm, 20% Final, 20% Policy Paper. He barely reads the policy paper and discussion posts just gives you a good grade on it. Quiz aren't lockdown. Midterm and Final are Lockdown Browser with Camera. No study guide and very poor communication because he's an active attorney and had a trial coming up.
Midterm and Final are difficult other than that pretty easy class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: great teacher, we had weekly quizzes and discussion posts. we have 3 tests, easy if you study. his lectures are amazing, short and straight to the point. the text book is mandatory and it really does help understand the topics and definitions more. really enjoyed this class 10/10 would take another of his classes.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria

comment: Starosto is super knowledgeable. Class was straight forward. Weekly quizess and a discussion post every other week. Essay due at the end of the semester but you work on it throughout the whole course. If I could take him for every law class I absolutely would. He's awesome.

The tests are the worst part of the class. I was in a GroupMe with a lot of fellow students and many pretty much made less than a 60 on the exams. I would say around the 40-60 range and he gave zero feedback, even when asked. I ended up dropping the class the last day I could at the end of October so I wasn't able to see how he graded the paper. GL

I enjoyed his class this semester. It was your typical discussion post and quiz every week. The only thing I am struggling with is the exams. We only have his lectures to go off of to get our information for the tests. I love his lectures but it is vague information compared to the specific questions on the exams. Exams are worth 50% of final grade

He is a nice professor and grades assignments very quickly, so you usually know what your grade is at all times. However, the textbook was disbanded this semester after purchasing which was lame because it was not cheap. But he does give interesting lectures, however, I feel like they did not help me with the exams.
Great teacher and gives good lectures and assignments, tests and quizzes come from book pretty straightforward would def take again
This professor is very straight forward all you have to do is read the textbook and you should be fine. but if you do not read do not expect to pass.

This dude is phenomenal. There's a quiz every week answers straight from the textbook and either an assignment or discussion post to go along with it. He is one of the easiest graders I have ever met and his rubrics basically tell you to turn stuff in on time and you get a 100. I never had to spend more than 30 min on an assignment or discussion.
Very straight forward professor. He doesn't hassle you and the syllabus is easy to follow. Follow the syllabus and you'll pass.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Listed wrong textbook in syllabus, so I am not doing well because I am not getting the right material. This is unacceptable and unprofessional in my opinion. Quizzes are hard because the questions don't come from the lectures or maybe they are in a different book (duh! proofread the syllabus). Also, doesn't really post announcements.
Great professor! that's all I have to say.

He is one of the easiest professors I have had. You have a quiz every week and you get two attempts on them. The answers come straight out of the textbook so you need to buy it. You also have some busy work assignments and discussions but they are so easy sometimes I think I am missing something. There are 2 exams w/ webcam and lockdown browser.

This was what every online class should be. Read your book, do discussions, take some quizzes, and two exams. If all of my classes would have been like this one then I would have made a higher grade, but unfortunately my other online classes took up an unnecessary amount of time. Wish all classes were like this one!

This professor is new to KSU and he understands work-life balance. You'll have a discussion every week, and a quiz every other week which is open book . Make time for both the discussion and the quizzes and you'll pass no doubt.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: He is new (2019) to KSU and also a defense attorney full time. All we had were quizzes, discussion boards, and two exams. Quizzes and tests come from his powerpoints and the book. Discussion boards are 4-7 sentences. Literally the most straightforward class and you actually learn. I wish he would've came to KSU sooner.
